snippet: Many business owners say relief from austerity measures imposed by foreign creditors will not be enough to reinvigorate growth.
abstract: Greek government of Prime Min Alexis Tsipras, fighting desperately to reduce austerity measures, face longer-term issues that could continue to hobble recovery despite outcome of battle; end of austerity alone would likely not be enough to restore country's fortunes; business owners and others cite nation's byzantine bureaucracy as a primary challenge.
lead_paragraph: Many business owners say relief from austerity measures imposed by foreign creditors will not be enough to reinvigorate growth.

headline.main: Greek Bureaucracy, Not Just Austerity, Is an Economic Drag
headline.print_headline: Greece Ponders the Other Danger to Its Economy: Its Bureaucratic Labyrinth
